block.p: Even Wall Street traders who make $1 million a year can be victims of sex discrimination in the workplace, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission declared after taking up a complaint against Morgan Stanley Dean Witter. Paving the way for lawsuits, the commission said the firm had discriminated against women who worked in its institutional stocks division and had retaliated against a trader, Allison K. Schieffelin, for complaining publicly. The firm denied the charges.
